Detailed Description

This is the base class for the AES algorithm.

It's used for manage the encryption or decryption key. To use AES classes, your compiler must support 64 bits numbers or, if it doesn't, the wxLongLong emulation.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum wxAESBase::wxAESKeyType

Key type enumeration.

This represents the 4 supported key type.

Enumerator:
wxAESUnknown  null key; this means no encryption o decryption will be done.

wxAES128  128 bits key length.

wxAES192  192 bits key length.

wxAES256  256 bits key length.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

wxAESBase::wxAESBase (  ) 

Constructor of the class.

It sets the encryption key to none; tring to encrypt data with this setting will result in a non-encrypted output buffer.

wxAESBase::~wxAESBase (  ) 

Destructor of the class.

Actually, it does nothing.

wxAESBase::wxAESBase ( const wxAESBase &  base  )  [inline]

The copy constructor: acts exactly in the same way as SetKeyFrom.

void wxAESBase::SetKey ( wxAESKeyType  type,
const wxString &  key 
)

Set the encryption or decryption key using a user provided string.

If a key is already been set, calling this function will overwrite the old one. The string is passed to the input stream SetKey function.

Parameters:
type enumeration identifing the key type (128, 1292, 256 bits).
key a string identifing the encryption or decryption key.
See also:
wxAESKeyType

SetKey(wxAESKeyType type, const wxInputStream &key)

void wxAESBase::SetKey ( wxAESKeyType  type,
const wxInputStream &  key 
)

Set the encryption or decryption key using a user provided input stream.

If a key is already been set, calling this function will overwrite the old one. The input stream content is hashed through the wxSHA256::Hash function and the result is passed to the binary SetKey function. Passing an empty input buffer, will not result in an error.

Parameters:
type enumeration identifing the key type (128, 1292, 256 bits).
key an input stream identifing the encryption or decryption key.
See also:
wxAESKeyType

void wxAESBase::SetKey ( wxAESKeyType  type,
void *  key 
)

Set the encryption or decryption key using a user provided binary buffer.

If a key is already been set, calling this function will overwrite the old one.

Parameters:
type enumeration identifing the key type (128, 1292, 256 bits).
key a binary buffer identifing the encryption or decryption key; it size must be big enough to contain the encryption key.
See also:
wxAESKeyType

SetKey(wxAESKeyType type, const wxInputStream &key)
